benchmark_details.name: Drowzee: Metamorphic Testing for Fact-Conflicting Hallucination Detection in Large Language Models
benchmark_details.overview: This work addresses the challenge of detecting fact-conflicting hallucinations (FCH) in large language models (LLMs) by introducing a novel testing framework utilizing logic programming and metamorphic testing.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To automatically generate and test hallucination cases in LLMs to ensure factual accuracy.
audience: Researchers in AI and machine learning
tasks: Detecting fact-conflicting hallucinations in LLM outputs
Validating reasoning processes of LLM responses

data.annotation: Automatically generated with ground truth answers

methodology.calculation: Hallucination rates calculated based on the responses of LLMs compared to ground truth.
methodology.interpretation: Analyzing logical reasoning between LLM responses and factual knowledge.
methodology.validation: Responses validated through semantic similarity assessment between LLM outputs and ground truth.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: Ensuring privacy through the use of publicly available knowledge bases.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: Data used is from open-source datasets (e.g., Wikipedia, Wikidata).
